definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: Such a young and capable man as him will put new life into our work.
sentences.chinese: 像他这样年轻有为的人会给我们的工作注入新生机。

sentences.english: Pavel Eskov – young talented graduate from Repin Institute.
sentences.chinese: 叶西科夫是列宾美术学院年轻有为的毕业生。

sentences.english: All promising young cricketers would like to play for England.
sentences.chinese: 所有年轻有为的板球运动员都愿意为英格兰打球。

sentences.english: He's a clever young man and knows how to play his cards well.

definition: well versed in letters and military technology (idiom); fine scholar and soldier/master of pen and sword
to regard sth as valuable/to think highly of (a younger person, a subordinate etc)
a galaxy of talent (idiom)/a great number of competent people
the young will be redoubtable in the years to come (idiom)/the younger generations will surpass us in time
to promote to a higher job/to select for promotion
to take up duty as/to assume a position/to assume/to take on (an office)
